title: Ecclesiastes Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Ecclesiastes with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 12 chapters.

questions.question: Who is identified as the author or speaker of Ecclesiastes?
options: The Preacher, the son of David, king in Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: The Preacher, the son of David, king in Jerusalem
questions.explanation: The book opens identifying the speaker as 'the Preacher, the son of David, king in Jerusalem,' traditionally understood as Solomon.

questions.question: What phrase is repeated to emphasize the theme of the book's opening?
questions.explanation: The phrase 'Vanity of vanities; all is vanity' sets the tone for the book's reflections on life's meaning.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 1, what is the profit of a man from all his labor under the sun?
questions.explanation: The Preacher reflects that labor under the sun yields vanity and vexation of spirit.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes say about the cycles of nature, such as the sun and the wind?
questions.explanation: The sun rises and sets, the wind turns about continually, and rivers run into the sea but are not full.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The thing that hath been, it is that which shall be; and that which is done is that which shall be done: and there is no _______ under the sun.'
questions.explanation: The verse states that there is no new thing under the sun.

questions.question: How does the Preacher describe his pursuit of wisdom and knowledge?
options: As a source of great joy
As a sore travail given by God
questions.correctAnswer: As a sore travail given by God
questions.explanation: He says God has given the sons of man a sore travail to seek and search out wisdom.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 3, what is there a time for?
questions.explanation: The chapter lists a time to every purpose under heaven, covering many opposites.

questions.question: True or False: Ecclesiastes 3 says 'A time to love, and a time to hate; a time of war, and a time of peace.'
questions.explanation: The verse acknowledges there are times for contrasting experiences, including love and hate, war and peace.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 3:11 say about God's work?
options: God’s work is unpredictable and chaotic
God hath made everything beautiful in his time
God’s work is easy to understand
God only works in the heavens
questions.correctAnswer: God hath made everything beautiful in his time
questions.explanation: The verse states that God makes everything beautiful in its time and sets the world in the heart of man.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 3, what is man's portion in life?
options: To rejoice and do good in his life
questions.correctAnswer: To rejoice and do good in his life
questions.explanation: Verse 12 emphasizes rejoicing and doing good as man's portion under the sun.

questions.question: True or False: Ecclesiastes 3 teaches that God will judge both the righteous and the wicked.
questions.explanation: The Preacher reflects that God will judge both the righteous and the wicked.

questions.question: What similarity does the Preacher draw between man and beasts in Ecclesiastes 3?
options: Man is superior in every way
Both have one breath and die alike
questions.correctAnswer: Both have one breath and die alike
questions.explanation: The Preacher points out that man and beasts share the same breath and both die, showing no preeminence.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'I know that, whatsoever God doeth, it shall be _______:'
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 3:14 states that what God does is eternal.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 5, how should one behave when going to the house of God?
options: Keep thy foot and be ready to hear
questions.correctAnswer: Keep thy foot and be ready to hear
questions.explanation: The Preacher advises to be more ready to hear than to give foolish sacrifices.

questions.question: True or False: Ecclesiastes 5 warns against making vows to God and not paying them.
questions.explanation: It teaches that it is better not to vow than to vow and not pay.

questions.question: What is said about the lover of silver in Ecclesiastes 5?
options: He shall not be satisfied with silver
questions.correctAnswer: He shall not be satisfied with silver
questions.explanation: The Preacher says that loving silver will never satisfy, which is vanity.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 5, what is the sleep of a laboring man like?
questions.explanation: The sleep of a laboring man is sweet, regardless of how much he eats.

questions.question: True or False: Ecclesiastes 5 says riches kept by their owners can be a sore evil.
questions.explanation: The Preacher observes that riches kept for their owners can be harmful.

questions.question: What is described as a gift of God in Ecclesiastes 5?
options: To eat, drink, and enjoy the good of labor
questions.correctAnswer: To eat, drink, and enjoy the good of labor
questions.explanation: It is a gift of God to enjoy the fruits of one’s labor.

questions.question: True or False: Ecclesiastes 7 states that a good name is better than precious ointment.
questions.explanation: The wise value a good name more than costly perfumes.

questions.question: Which is considered better in Ecclesiastes 7:2: going to the house of mourning or to the house of feasting?
questions.explanation: Going to the house of mourning is better because it teaches the living to reflect.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 7, what is better than laughter?
questions.explanation: Sorrow is better than laughter because it can lead to heart improvement.

questions.question: True or False: Ecclesiastes 7 teaches that a wise man’s heart is in the house of mourning.
questions.explanation: The heart of the wise dwells in the house of mourning, reflecting on mortality.

questions.question: What comparison is used to describe the laughter of a fool in Ecclesiastes 7?
options: The cracking of thorns under a pot
questions.correctAnswer: The cracking of thorns under a pot
questions.explanation: Foolish laughter is compared to the crackling of thorns, which is noisy and soon burns out.

questions.question: True or False: Ecclesiastes 7 states that there is not a just man upon earth who doeth good and sinneth not.
questions.explanation: It acknowledges that all humans sin although they may do good.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Lo, this only have I found, that God hath made man _______; but they have sought out many inventions.'
questions.explanation: God made man upright, but man has sought many schemes.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 8 say about the king’s word and judgment?
options: The king’s word is not important
The king’s commandment is powerful and must be obeyed quickly
The king has no power over judgment
questions.correctAnswer: The king’s commandment is powerful and must be obeyed quickly
questions.explanation: The chapter advises obeying the king’s command because of his power.

questions.question: True or False: Ecclesiastes 8 teaches that no man can find out the work that God maketh from the beginning to the end.
questions.explanation: It states that the work of God is beyond human understanding.

questions.question: What is said about the righteous and the wicked in Ecclesiastes 8?
questions.explanation: The chapter acknowledges that both the righteous and the wicked may die suddenly.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 9, what happens to all, whether righteous or wicked?
options: All go unto one place, the dust
Only the righteous go to heaven
questions.correctAnswer: All go unto one place, the dust
questions.explanation: All mankind returns to dust after death.

questions.question: True or False: Ecclesiastes 9 encourages enjoying life because no one knows what will happen after death.
questions.explanation: The Preacher advises rejoicing in life because the afterlife is unknown.

questions.question: What advice does Ecclesiastes 10 give concerning a wise man's heart and a fool's heart?
options: A wise man's heart is at his right hand, a fool's at his left
The fool's heart is better than the wise man's
questions.correctAnswer: A wise man's heart is at his right hand, a fool's at his left
questions.explanation: This illustrates the practical advantage of wisdom over folly.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Dead flies cause the ointment of the apothecary to send forth a _______ savour.'
questions.explanation: Dead flies spoil the perfume, illustrating how little things can ruin good works.

questions.question: True or False: Ecclesiastes 11 advises to cast your bread upon the waters and it will return after many days.
questions.explanation: This metaphor encourages generosity and investment without immediate return.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 11 say about the uncertainty of life and the clouds?
options: Clouds may be full and yet no rain falls
questions.correctAnswer: Clouds may be full and yet no rain falls
questions.explanation: It teaches that not all efforts result in expected outcomes.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 12, when should one remember their Creator?
questions.explanation: The Preacher urges remembrance of God before difficult days come.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Or ever the silver cord be loosed, or the golden bowl be broken, or the pitcher be broken at the _______.'
questions.explanation: The verse uses imagery of a broken bowl at the fountain to describe death.

questions.question: True or False: Ecclesiastes 12 describes the aging process with vivid imagery such as trembling keepers of the house and darkened windows.
questions.explanation: The passage poetically describes the decline of the body in old age.

questions.question: What is the final conclusion about fearing God in Ecclesiastes 12?
options: It is the whole duty of man
It is a minor part of life
questions.correctAnswer: It is the whole duty of man
questions.explanation: The book ends emphasizing that fearing God and keeping his commandments is man's whole duty.

questions.question: True or False: Ecclesiastes teaches that wisdom is better than strength and money.
questions.explanation: Wisdom is praised as more excellent than money and strength.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes say about the day of death compared to the day of one's birth?
options: The day of birth is better
The day of death is better
questions.correctAnswer: The day of death is better
questions.explanation: It states that the day of death is better than the day of birth.

questions.question: True or False: Ecclesiastes 1 says 'There is no remembrance of former things; neither shall there be any remembrance of things that are to come.'
questions.explanation: This verse reflects on the fleeting nature of memory and history.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 9, what should a living person do given life's uncertainties?
options: Enjoy pleasure and eat and drink with a merry heart
questions.correctAnswer: Enjoy pleasure and eat and drink with a merry heart
questions.explanation: The Preacher encourages enjoying life despite uncertainties.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes say about the effects of many words and dreams in Ecclesiastes 5?
options: They lead to vanity and folly
questions.correctAnswer: They lead to vanity and folly
questions.explanation: Many words and dreams can lead to vanities, so one should fear God.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Better is the end of a thing than the _______ thereof: and the patient in spirit is better than the proud in spirit.'
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 7:8 states that the end is better than the beginning.
